alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:59AM EDT until May 02 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Grafton and Belknap Counties. Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters reach West Side Road. Much of Transvale Acres floods from Moat Brook Bridge east to the Saco River. Numerous structures become flooded with buildings on campgrounds flooded by several feet. Campers should move to higher grounds. At 13.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs on West Side Road in two sections, cutting off access to hundreds of homes. River Road flooded on the west bank impacting agricultural lands. Floodwaters inundate first floors of properties in Transvale Acres. This is a dangerous situation at riverside campgrounds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 12.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 7.4 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 7.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
